attributes.action: change the UK quarantine laws to exempt search and rescue dogs which have done life saving work overseas.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Darcy, Essex County Fire and Rescue Service’s search and rescue dog, will have to spend six months in quarantine after going to Indonesia to carry out life saving search and rescue work. We believe that rescue dogs should be exempt from the quarantine laws. Six months imprisonment does not seem like a fitting reward for a dog which has worked abroad to try and save lives.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to change the UK quarantine laws to exempt search and rescue dogs which have done life saving work overseas.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 


http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=FreeDarcy


Her Majesty's Government
